doc.after: These effects are not merely appearances they are explicitly related to our way of measuring time intervals between events which occur at the same place in a given coordinate system called co local events These time intervals will be different in another coordinate system moving with respect to the first unless the events are also simultaneous Similarly these effects also relate to our measured distances between separated but simultaneous events in a given coordinate system of choice If these events are not co local but are separated by distance space they will not occur at the same spatial distance from each other when seen from another moving coordinate system However the spacetime interval will be the same for all observers The underlying reality remains the same Only our perspective changes
